answers.author: Josephine Valencia
answers.text:
At my last job we had a voluntary program where we encouraged folks to not use their desk side trash can, but to place stuff in the larger break room trash can instead.  We got a much better response than anticipated.  While we didn’t officially reduce janitorial collection frequency, there was a significant decrease in the amount of cans that needed emptying.  This was a one story building with a designated “break” area.  Individual coffee pots, refrigerators, etc., were not common in the offices.  We also instructed janitorial staff to not automatically replace the bag liners if they didn’t have “icky” wet trash.   They just dumped the small can into the large cart they wheeled around.  One of the custodians came up with that idea;  he had been doing it for years because he said it was faster.

answers.text:
Hi Josephine - yes, the City of Charlottesville did just that.  We have large cans that act as both trash and recycling recepticles that are in central places around City Hall.  Trash cans in offices are now emptied once a week which seems to be working just fine.
